intro: Eriachne tawadae, commonly known as the Tawadae grass, is a flowering plant native to the island of Okinawa in Japan. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
